title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping tale of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the American South. Through the eyes of Scout Finch, we witness her father Atticus defending a black man wrongly accused of a crime.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel that follows Winston Smith, a member of the Outer Party who works for the Ministry of Truth. The novel explores themes of totalitarianism and surveillance.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: Set in the Jazz Age on Long Island, the novel chronicles narrator Nick Carraway's interactions with the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and Gatsby's obsession with reuniting with his former lover, Daisy Buchanan.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of Elizabeth Bennet, who learns the error of making hasty judgments and comes to appreciate the difference between superficial goodness and actual goodness.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins enjoys a comfortable life until the wizard Gandalf and thirteen dwarves arrive to take him on an adventure to reclaim their treasure from the dragon Smaug. A timeless fantasy classic.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first novel in the Harry Potter series follows young wizard Harry Potter as he discovers his magical heritage and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of Holden Caulfield, a teenager who has been expelled from prep school. The novel explores themes of alienation and the phoniness of the adult world.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A thought-provoking exploration of human history from the Stone Age to the modern age, examining how Homo sapiens came to dominate the world.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a young woman who grows up in a strict and abusive household in rural Idaho but eventually escapes to learn about the wider world through education.

title: The Selfish Gene
author: Richard Dawkins
description: A groundbreaking work that popularized the gene-centered view of evolution. Dawkins uses the gene as the principal unit of selection in evolution.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: The intimate memoir of the former First Lady of the United States, chronicling her experiences from childhood through her years in the White House.

title: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: The exclusive biography of Steve Jobs, based on more than forty interviews with Jobs conducted over two years. The book chronicles his life from childhood to his final days.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: An easy and proven way to build good habits and break bad ones. Clear provides a practical guide based on the latest scientific research on habit formation.

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
author: Stephen R. Covey
description: A holistic approach to personal and interpersonal effectiveness. Covey presents a principle-centered approach for solving personal and professional problems.

title: The Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
description: A new approach to business that's being adopted around the world. It favors experimentation over planning and customer feedback over intuition.

title: Clean Code
author: Robert C. Martin
description: Even bad code can function. But if code isn't clean it can bring a development organization to its knees. This book teaches the craft of writing clean code.

title: Thinking Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: A groundbreaking tour of the mind explaining the two systems that drive the way we think: System 1 is fast and emotional; System 2 is slower and more logical.

title: The Art of War
author: Sun Tzu
description: An ancient Chinese military treatise that has been applied to business and management strategies. It emphasizes the importance of positioning in military strategy.

title: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
description: From the Big Bang to black holes, Hawking guides readers through the complex theories of cosmology in an accessible way.

title: The Power of Now
author: Eckhart Tolle
description: A guide to spiritual enlightenment that teaches readers how to live in the present moment and free themselves from anxiety and stress.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Set in the distant future amidst a huge interstellar empire, the novel tells the story of young Paul Atreides whose family accepts control of the desert planet Arrakis.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic high-fantasy novel following the quest to destroy the One Ring. The story follows hobbit Frodo Baggins as he and the Fellowship embark on a quest to destroy the Ring.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A novel about following your dreams. It tells the story of Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd boy who travels from Spain to Egypt in search of treasure.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: The diary kept by Anne Frank while she was in hiding for two years with her family during the Nazi occupation of the Netherlands.

title: Man's Search for Meaning
author: Viktor E. Frankl
description: A psychiatrist's memoir of life in Nazi death camps and its lessons for spiritual survival. Frankl argues that we cannot avoid suffering but we can choose how to cope with it.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
description: A series of seven fantasy novels that tells the story of children who play central roles in the unfolding history of the Narnian world.

title: Good to Great
author: Jim Collins
description: A management book examining how companies transition from being good companies to great companies and how most companies fail to make the transition.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A comic science fiction series following the adventures of Arthur Dent, the last surviving man following Earth's destruction by Vogons.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel set in a futuristic World State of genetically modified citizens and an intelligence-based social hierarchy.

title: The Little Prince
author: Antoine de Saint-Exup√©ry
description: A novella about a young prince who visits various planets in space including Earth. The story explores themes of loneliness, friendship, love, and loss.
